learning_outcomes.description: Integrate knowledge of biochemistry, microbial growth, enzyme kinetics and biotechnology for analysing the performance of bioreactor processes.
Critically assess bioprocessing applications based on analytical data and how they can be optimised.
Apply bioprocessing design principles to fermentation, sterilisation and downstream processing equipment.
Operate and monitor bioreactor processes hands-on.

assessments.task_description:
A set of problems that covers course content addressed in that fortnight will be performed regularly throughout the course. Feedback will be provided. The 20% grade encompasses 4% per weekly tutorial submission (6 in total), where the worst grade received on the problem sets will not be counted towards this mark. One of these problem sets will be devoted to a brief report regarding the field trip to Thermofisher/Patheon (further details to be provided).

The due dates for the problem sets will be: 17/03, 31/03, 14/04, 6/05, 23/05 and 30/05 (last day of classes). The time each problem set will be due is 4pm.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Problem sets are due following the tutorial every fortnight. They can be submitted online via Turnitin on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Exam In-Semester Outside Scheduled Class Time
assessments.task_description:
Students will be responsible for content delivered in the lectures and tutorials. The basic format of the exam involves multiple choice, short answer and problem solving questions. Students will be invigilated. This assessment task is to be completed in-person.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Individual prac reports due. Full report details and requirements will be provided on Blackboard. School mandatory completion of Undergraduate Laboratory Induction prior to pracs.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be responsible for content delivered in the lectures, tutorials and pracs. The basic format of the exam involves multiple choice, short answer and problem solving questions. 

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials and in-class exercises

Tutorial problems and in-class exercises associated with each week's lecture content.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials and in-class exercises Tutorial problems and in-class exercises associated with each week's lecture content.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 2(24 Feb - 09 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 - Introduction

Introduction to the course and the background principles of bioprocess engineering. Enzyme kinetics and inhibition.


Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 - Introduction Introduction to the course and the background principles of bioprocess engineering. Enzyme kinetics and inhibition.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 6(10 Mar - 06 Apr)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 2 - Stoichiometry and Kinetics

Cell metabolism, stoichiometric mass balance concepts, Monod kinetics, cell maintenance, introduction to metabolic flux analysis.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 2 - Stoichiometry and Kinetics Cell metabolism, stoichiometric mass balance concepts, Monod kinetics, cell maintenance, introduction to metabolic flux analysis.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 8(07 Apr - 20 Apr)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 3 - Bioreactor design

Bioreactor design principles and concepts for different bioreactor configurations. Growth of bacteria vs mammalian cells, mass transfer limitations.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 3 - Bioreactor design Bioreactor design principles and concepts for different bioreactor configurations. Growth of bacteria vs mammalian cells, mass transfer limitations.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Week 13(28 Apr - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Module 4 - Industrial applications

Application of bioprocess engineering: industry guest lectures, biopharmaceuticals, up/down stream processing.


Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 4 - Industrial applications Application of bioprocess engineering: industry guest lectures, biopharmaceuticals, up/down stream processing.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Week 10(28 Apr - 11 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Prac activities

Two pracs will be conducted, involving operating lab-scale bioreactors and monitoring them through assessing the biomass growth rate, as well as the
oxygen transfer and uptake rate and other relevant process parameters.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Prac activities Two pracs will be conducted, involving operating lab-scale bioreactors and monitoring them through assessing the biomass growth rate, as well as the oxygen transfer and uptake rate and other relevant process parameters.

learning_activities.topic:
Field Trip

A guided field trip will take place to Thermofisher/Patheon in 37 Kent St, Woolloongabba QLD 4102, with an accompanying report. The class will split into 2 groups and the tour will be 2h.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Field Trip A guided field trip will take place to Thermofisher/Patheon in 37 Kent St, Woolloongabba QLD 4102, with an accompanying report. The class will split into 2 groups and the tour will be 2h.
